revised_title: Chromatology and Pigment Analysis in Actiniae Species
tldr: The author examines various Actiniae species to analyze their chromatology and pigment composition. They discover the presence of a pigment similar to haemoglobin in Actinia mesembryanthemum and a chlorophyll-like spectrum in Bunodes ballii, Sagartia, and Anthea cereus. The study also reveals the presence of a green pigment similar to biliverdin and a new pigment in Sagartia species.
